meanings.definition: The art movement characterized by the use of small dots or strokes of color to create a larger image.
meanings.sent1: In divisionism, artists create paintings by placing tiny dots of color next to each other.
meanings.sent2: Many painters in the divisionism movement used pointillism to form their artworks.
meanings.sent3: The art class had a divisionism project where students had to paint using only small dots.
meanings.sent4: Her painting resembled divisionism, with each dot representing a different emotion.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of divisionism lies in the meticulous placement of each colored dot to form a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The belief in or advocacy of dividing a group or society into smaller factions.
meanings.sent1: Divisionism can lead to conflicts within a community if not handled carefully.
meanings.sent2: The politician's divisionism caused tension among the citizens, leading to disagreements.
meanings.sent3: His extreme divisionism made him want to split the school into separate groups for every subject.
meanings.sent4: The divisionism in the company resulted in different departments working against each other.
meanings.sent5: The dangers of divisionism became evident as the once-united group started to break apart.
